climbs.name: Public Service Announcement
climbs.fa: FA: Maria Henderson, Tom Wells, Mike Mott & Alek Tkach (July 1996)

content.description: Some thoughtful slab moves up 3 bolts lead to a great pull on a HUGE flake over the bulge, then easy climbing to the anchors. Good route, but rock quality on the lower portion is a little suspect, as with most routes on this wall. Beware.
content.location: Starts just to the left of the obvious sooty cave.

content.description:
Much more thoughtful than its equivalently-graded neighbor, this climb starts with some delicate stem moves up a vague dihedral feature to a ledge, then climbs on not-so-positive holds up to the slab and on to the anchors.

Good movement, good frictiony holds. Cruxes are both the start and pulling the bulge.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchors. Shares chain anchor with "Public Enema" to the left.
content.location: Starts directly between the crag and the obvious detached boulder in a small dihedral feature.

content.description: Starts in a small corner-ish feature just to the left of the "belay boulder". Pull pockets to a ledge just above the first bolt, then progress pretty straightforward up the boltline and trend right to a chained anchor.
content.location: First boltline right of the small charred cave thingy...

climbs.name: Lincoln Logs
climbs.fa: Alek Tkach, Tom Wells & Mike Mott (August 1996)

content.description: Short boulder problem up to the second bolt and then a cake-walk up the slab to the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts(assuming you clip the last bolt of "Legos") to a chain anchor shared with "Legos".
content.location: Start just right of a tall bush on the right side of Public Service Wall.

climbs.name: Legos
climbs.fa: Mike Mott, Tom Wells & Alek Tkach (July 1996)

content.description: Good moves past the first three bolts on the face lead to an easy slab. Well bolted for new leaders.
content.location: Rightmost route on Public Service Wall.
